51705260DFE8013101B368A86D17958E.description: Recognize how individual health behavior affects the health and well-being of others. CEH, FAM, VP/B

517010F0DFE8013101B268A86D17958E.description: Describe the ways people are similar and different. FAM, VP/B

516FCF30DFE8013101B168A86D17958E.description: Identify goals for enhancing health. PA, PH, NUT

516F8ED0DFE8013101B068A86D17958E.description: Describe why health goals are important. PH

516F4980DFE8013101AF68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate control of impulsive behavior (anger management, delayed gratification, etc.). ME, VP/B, IP/S

516EEC90DFE8013101AE68A86D17958E.description: Recognize and accurately label emotions and how they are linked to behavior (anger, sadness, joy, etc.). ME, VP/B

516E8D00DFE8013101AD68A86D17958E.description: Identify behaviors that prevent the spread of disease. CEH, PH, PCD

516E4B00DFE8013101AC68A86D17958E.description: Identify behaviors that help avoid or reduce health risks. IP/S, VP/B, ATOD

516DFBA0DFE8013101AB68A86D17958E.description: Identify behaviors that improve or maintain personal health. PA, NUT, PH

516DBC10DFE8013101AA68A86D17958E.description: Personal and Social Responsibility: Students will demonstrate the ability to use personal and social skills that are associated with taking responsible action for enhancing health and reducing or avoiding health risks.

516D7A60DFE8013101A968A86D17958E.description: Identify characteristics of effective listening skills to enhance health or reduce/avoid health risks (e.g., eyes on speaker, etc.). PCD, IP/S, FA

516D3960DFE8013101A868A86D17958E.description: Identify appropriate ways to respond to/in unwanted, threatening or dangerous situations. IP/S, PH, VP/B

516CF050DFE8013101A768A86D17958E.description: Identify characteristics of effective communication for the purpose of expressing health needs, wants, and feelings (e.g., eye contact, clear purpose, etc.). PH, ME, FAM

516CB5C0DFE8013101A668A86D17958E.description: Identify various methods to express individual health needs, wants, and feelings (e.g., visual, verbal, physical). PH, ME, FAM

516C7AB0DFE8013101A568A86D17958E.description: Effective Communication: Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health and reduce or avoid health risks.

516C3F50DFE8013101A468A86D17958E.description: Recognize health-related problems that exist at home and school (e.g., soap dispenser is empty, students not washing hands after going to bathroom, ice on the playground). PH, IP/S, VP/B

516C03C0DFE8013101A368A86D17958E.description: Describe how family can influence decisions students make about health practices and risk behaviors (e.g., washing hands, not wearing seatbelts). FAM, PH, PCD

516BC5D0DFE8013101A268A86D17958E.description: Describe how health related decisions can affect self or others (e.g., decision to sneeze into sleeve prevents spreading germs to others). IP/S, PCD

516B7F60DFE8013101A168A86D17958E.description: Recognize when assistance is needed for making a decision. IP/S, VP/B, ATOD

516B3530DFE8013101A068A86D17958E.description: Identify situations where a health related decision is needed. IP/S, PH, FAM

516AF9C0DFE80131019F68A86D17958E.description: Problem Solving and Decision Making: Students will use critical thinking and systematic processes to examine health related problems and make decisions that enhance health and reduce or avoid health risks.

516ABDF0DFE80131019E68A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to contact or find help for health and safety emergencies (e.g., call 911, find playground monitor). VP/B, IP/S, FA

516A7FC0DFE80131019D68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to locate help at school to reduce or avoid health risks (e.g., knowing where to find custodian, principal, school nurse). PCD, PH, IP/S

516A3F70DFE80131019C68A86D17958E.description: Identify people who can help students reduce their risks (e.g. trusted adult, family member, school nurse, doctor etc.). IP/S, FAM, VP/B

5169FBC0DFE80131019B68A86D17958E.description: Identify people who can help students enhance their health (e.g. trusted adult, family member, school nurse, doctor etc.). FAM, IP/S, PCD

5169A830DFE80131019A68A86D17958E.description: Health Information, Products and Resources: Students will access, analyze and evaluate health information, products and resources.
